      • defineVariable

        public java.lang.String defineVariable(java.lang.String undefinedVariable)
        Description copied from interface: ComputeManager
        Prompts the user to define the variable which is currently undefined. This allows users to not define things until the equation is run. The user just gets prompted everytime Compute doesn't recognize any constant.
        Specified by:
        defineVariable in interface ComputeManager

      • process

        public void process()
        ********************************************* ** USER CODE of MathCalc goes here *** *********************************************

        MathCalc is unlike most other Units in that it does not itself directly initiate the input of the data. Instead, the user types an expression into the parameter window. When the user types "Return" the expression is sent to Compute, which parses it and decides what the output type will be and whether input data is needed. (This is indicated by the presence in the expression of identifiers for data from input nodes of the form #0c and #1s etc.) Method process() asks Compute for the answer, and this initiates the actual computation, during which, if data is needed, Compute calls method getInputData below. When the expression has been evaluated it is returned to method process() so that process() can do the output.

        Specified by:
        process in class Unit

      • getInputData

        public double[] getInputData(int i)
        Gets the data from the ith input node from the unit which implements this interface. A double array is returned containing the data. If the length of the data is one then the input data must have been a scaler value, otherwise an array of values is returned.
        Specified by:
        getInputData in interface ComputeManager

      • println

        public void println(java.lang.String text)
        Prints the text to the debug stream for the unit followed by a line feed. This function just returns if there is no debug window.
        Specified by:
